tests.cleann_KF module¶

tests.cleann_KF.create_kf_and_assign_predict_update(dim_z, X, P, A, Q, dt, R, H, B, U)¶
Parameters:tuple (configs) – all the values to define the kalman filter
Returns:Kalman Filter
tests.cleann_KF.preprocess(num_measured, measured_var, covar, process_model, white_noise_var, dt, sensor_covar, measurement_function, B=0, U=0)¶
Parameters:
  • num_measured – size of measurement vector. For example: if there is only one sensor that measures position x then num_measured = 1 # noqa: E501, W291
  • measured_var – Mean state variables vector For example: State variables can be either observed (directly measured by a sensor) or # noqa: E501 hidden variables (inferred from observed variables). For a sensor that measures the x (position - e.x 10) # noqa: E501 of a car, we can infer the velocity (dx - e.x 4.5) Therefore mean state variable vector is [10, 4.5].T for a 2d case measured_var = (10,4.5) # noqa: W291
  • covar – Covariance matrix of all state variables For example: if the variance of x = 500 and dx = 49 and the correlation is unknown # noqa: E501 covar = ((500,0),(0,49))
  • process_model –

    Transition matrix for process For example: The relationship between x and dx is: x’ = 1* x + (dt) dx where dt = 0.1 # noqa: E501

    dx’ = 0* x + (1) dx (for our purposes)

    Then process_model= ((1, 0.1), (0, 1))

  • white_noise_var – Variance of noise in process (float)
  • dt – time step (in seconds)
  • sensor_covar – Variance in sensor measurement (noise) For example: If only one sensor is used to measure x sensor_covar = (5) If two sensors are used to measure x and dx sensor_covar = (5,0),(0,2) etc
  • measurement_function – Converts state to measurement For example: if the measurement is x from the sensor but the state variable is x and dx then in matrix form : x - [1 0] [x, dx] = x - x Measurement_function = (1,0)
  • B – Control input matrix
  • U – Control input
Returns:

all the variables above in np.array form
tests.cleann_KF.run_kf(data, dim_of_measurements, measured_var, covar, process_model, white_noise_var, dt, sensor_covar, measurement_function)¶

This runs the kalman filter on noisy data entered :return: Filtered data, covariances and kalman filter used

tests.cleann_KF.run_smoother(kf, xs, ps)¶
Parameters:
  • kf – Kalman filter used in filter step
  • xs – filtered data
  • ps – covariances
Returns:

x = smoothed data, P = covariances
tests.cleann_KF.visualise(x, y, x_messy, x_real=None)¶
Parameters:
  • x – filterd/smoothed data
  • y – covariances
  • x_real – real data
  • x_messy – raw measurements from sensors
Returns:

plot comparing raw data and smooth/filtered data
